TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {18134=Letter 1196 (DO/CG), First Request for Additional Information, Letter 1955 (DO/CG), Second and Subsequent Request for Additional Information, and Letter 1197 (DO/CG), Ten-Day Letter, are the primary development letters for EP determination cases. The user must first follow the instructions in IRM 7.14.4, EDS Employee Plan User Manual - Letter Generation, for creating or accessing the entity information before creating the letter., 18923=In creating the cover letter, the specialist must enter only the required paragraph numbers and type in the variable information such as the response date. See Exhibit 7.13.5-8, Letter 1196 (DO/CG) First Request for Additional Information, Exhibit 7.13.5-9, Letter 1197 (DO/CG)Ten-Day Letter, and Exhibit 7.13.5-19, Letter 1955 (DO/CG) Second and Subsequent Request for Additional Information. These paragraph numbers will be reflected at the bottom of the Create-Letter-Screen., 11397=Paragraphs numbered in series 100 through 2999 and 7000 through 7999 are printed as an enclosure to the letter in the order entered on the Create-Letter-Screen., 6864=(1) Exhibit 7.13.5-11, Letter 1520 (DO/CG) Letter for Group Trust Arrangement, was modified to reflect new language in paragraph 1., 128437=Paragraphs 8000 and 8001 are required for the 1197 letter. Paragraph 8000 information should include information for the "Refer Reply to:" from the header of the letter. Paragraph 8001 should include information for the "Previous Contact Date" from the header of the letter., 136497=Paragraphs 8000 and 8001 are required for the 1399 letter. Paragraph 8000 information should include information for the "Refer Reply to:" from the header of the letter. Paragraph 8001 should include information for the "Required Response Date" from the header of the letter., 7045=(2) Exhibit 7.13.5-20, Letter 2002 (DO/CG) Favorable Determination Letter, was modified to add caveat 27 for use with pre-approved defined benefit plans., 6472=August 28, 2012}
textBeforeTable: Exhibit 7.13.5-2  Letter 835 (DO/CG) Favorable Determination Letter (GUST) 5-31 Form 2706 Acknowledgement of filing Form 5310-A 5-30 4577 (DO/CG) Autoclosure 5-29 3577 (DO/CG) Quality Assurance Staff Assignment Letter 5-28 3335 (DO/CG) Case Assignment Letter 5-27 2927 (DO/CG) Dishonored User Fee Check Letter 5-26 2337 (DO/CG) Letter Granting Extension of Time to Submit Info (User Fees) 5-25
textAfterTable: 1 (Automatic)  We have made a favorable determination on your plan identified above based on the information supplied. Please keep this letter, the application forms submitted to request this letter and all correspondence with the Internal Revenue Service regarding your application for a determination letter in your permanent records. You must retain this information to preserve your reliance on this letter. 2 (Automatic)  Continued qualification of the plan under its present form will depend on its effect in operation. (See section 1.401-1(b)(3) of the Income Tax Regulations.) We will review the status of the plan in operation periodically. 3 (Automatic)  The enclosed Publication 794 explains the significance and the scope of this favorable determination letter based on the determination requests selected on your application forms. Publication 794 describes the information that must be retained to have reliance on this favorable determination letter. This publication also provide examples of the effects of a plan's operation on its qualified status and discusses the reporting requirements for qualified plans. Please read Publication 794.
